20/* Id */
21
22#ifndef ISC_APP_H
23#define ISC_APP_H 1
24
25/*****
26 ***** Module Info
27 *****/
28
29/*! \file isc/app.h
30 * \brief ISC Application Support
31 *
32 * Dealing with program termination can be difficult, especially in a
33 * multithreaded program. The routines in this module help coordinate
34 * the shutdown process. They are used as follows by the initial (main)
35 * thread of the application:
36 *
37 *\li isc_app_start(); Call very early in main(), before
38 * any other threads have been created.
39 *
40 *\li isc_app_run(); This will post any on-run events,
41 * and then block until application
42 * shutdown is requested. A shutdown
43 * request is made by calling
44 * isc_app_shutdown(), or by sending
45 * SIGINT or SIGTERM to the process.
46 * After isc_app_run() returns, the
47 * application should shutdown itself.
48 *
49 *\li isc_app_finish(); Call very late in main().
50 *
51 * Applications that want to use SIGHUP/isc_app_reload() to trigger reloading
52 * should check the result of isc_app_run() and call the reload routine if
53 * the result is ISC_R_RELOAD. They should then call isc_app_run() again
54 * to resume waiting for reload or termination.
55 *
56 * Use of this module is not required. In particular, isc_app_start() is
57 * NOT an ISC library initialization routine.
58 *
59 * This module also supports per-thread 'application contexts'. With this
60 * mode, a thread-based application will have a separate context, in which
61 * it uses other ISC library services such as tasks or timers. Signals are
62 * not caught in this mode, so that the application can handle the signals
63 * in its preferred way.
64 *
65 * \li MP:
66 * Clients must ensure that isc_app_start(), isc_app_run(), and
67 * isc_app_finish() are called at most once. isc_app_shutdown()
68 * is safe to use by any thread (provided isc_app_start() has been
69 * called previously).
70 *
71 * The same note applies to isc_app_ctxXXX() functions, but in this case
72 * it's a per-thread restriction. For example, a thread with an
73 * application context must ensure that isc_app_ctxstart() with the
74 * context is called at most once.
75 *
76 * \li Reliability:
77 * No anticipated impact.
78 *
79 * \li Resources:
80 * None.
81 *
82 * \li Security:
83 * No anticipated impact.
84 *
85 * \li Standards:
86 * None.
87 */
88
89#include <isc/eventclass.h>
90#include <isc/lang.h>
91#include <isc/magic.h>
92#include <isc/result.h>
93
94/***
95 *** Types
96 ***/
97
98typedef isc_event_t isc_appevent_t;
99
100#define ISC_APPEVENT_FIRSTEVENT (ISC_EVENTCLASS_APP + 0)
101#define ISC_APPEVENT_SHUTDOWN (ISC_EVENTCLASS_APP + 1)
102#define ISC_APPEVENT_LASTEVENT (ISC_EVENTCLASS_APP + 65535)
103
104/*%
105 * app module methods. Only app driver implementations use this structure.
106 * Other clients should use the top-level interfaces (i.e., isc_app_xxx
107 * functions). magic must be ISCAPI_APPMETHODS_MAGIC.
108 */
109typedef struct isc_appmethods {
110 void (*ctxdestroy)(isc_appctx_t **ctxp);
111 isc_result_t (*ctxstart)(isc_appctx_t *ctx);
112 isc_result_t (*ctxrun)(isc_appctx_t *ctx);
113 isc_result_t (*ctxsuspend)(isc_appctx_t *ctx);
114 isc_result_t (*ctxshutdown)(isc_appctx_t *ctx);
115 void (*ctxfinish)(isc_appctx_t *ctx);
116 void (*settaskmgr)(isc_appctx_t *ctx,
117 isc_taskmgr_t *timermgr);
118 void (*setsocketmgr)(isc_appctx_t *ctx,
119 isc_socketmgr_t *timermgr);
120 void (*settimermgr)(isc_appctx_t *ctx,
121 isc_timermgr_t *timermgr);
122} isc_appmethods_t;
123
124/*%
125 * This structure is actually just the common prefix of an application context
126 * implementation's version of an isc_appctx_t.
127 * \brief
128 * Direct use of this structure by clients is forbidden. app implementations
129 * may change the structure. 'magic' must be ISCAPI_APPCTX_MAGIC for any
130 * of the isc_app_ routines to work. app implementations must maintain
131 * all app context invariants.
132 */
133struct isc_appctx {
134 unsigned int impmagic;
135 unsigned int magic;
136 isc_appmethods_t *methods;
137};
138
139#define ISCAPI_APPCTX_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('A','a','p','c')
140#define ISCAPI_APPCTX_VALID(c) ((c) != NULL && \
141 (c)->magic == ISCAPI_APPCTX_MAGIC)
142
143ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
144
145isc_result_t
146isc_app_ctxstart(isc_appctx_t *ctx);
147
148isc_result_t
149isc_app_start(void);
150/*!<
151 * \brief Start an ISC library application.
152 *
153 * Notes:
154 * This call should be made before any other ISC library call, and as
155 * close to the beginning of the application as possible.
156 *
157 * Requires:
158 * 'ctx' is a valid application context (for app_ctxstart()).
159 */
160
161isc_result_t
162isc_app_onrun(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action,
163 void *arg);
164/*!<
165 * \brief Request delivery of an event when the application is run.
166 *
167 * Requires:
168 *\li isc_app_start() has been called.
169 *
170 * Returns:
171 * ISC_R_SUCCESS
172 * ISC_R_NOMEMORY
173 */
174
175isc_result_t
176isc_app_ctxrun(isc_appctx_t *ctx);
177
178isc_result_t
179isc_app_run(void);
180/*!<
181 * \brief Run an ISC library application.
182 *
183 * Notes:
184 *\li The caller (typically the initial thread of an application) will
185 * block until shutdown is requested. When the call returns, the
186 * caller should start shutting down the application.
187 *
188 * Requires:
189 *\li isc_app_[ctx]start() has been called.
190 *
191 * Ensures:
192 *\li Any events requested via isc_app_onrun() will have been posted (in
193 * FIFO order) before isc_app_run() blocks.
194 *\li 'ctx' is a valid application context (for app_ctxrun()).
195 *
196 * Returns:
197 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS Shutdown has been requested.
198 *\li ISC_R_RELOAD Reload has been requested.
199 */
200
201isc_result_t
202isc_app_ctxshutdown(isc_appctx_t *ctx);
203
204isc_result_t
205isc_app_shutdown(void);
206/*!<
207 * \brief Request application shutdown.
208 *
209 * Notes:
210 *\li It is safe to call isc_app_shutdown() multiple times. Shutdown will
211 * only be triggered once.
212 *
213 * Requires:
214 *\li isc_app_[ctx]run() has been called.
215 *\li 'ctx' is a valid application context (for app_ctxshutdown()).
216 *
217 * Returns:
218 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
219 *\li ISC_R_UNEXPECTED
220 */
221
222isc_result_t
223isc_app_ctxsuspend(isc_appctx_t *ctx);
224/*!<
225 * \brief This has the same behavior as isc_app_ctxsuspend().
226 */
227
228isc_result_t
229isc_app_reload(void);
230/*!<
231 * \brief Request application reload.
232 *
233 * Requires:
234 *\li isc_app_run() has been called.
235 *
236 * Returns:
237 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
238 *\li ISC_R_UNEXPECTED
239 */
240
241void
242isc_app_ctxfinish(isc_appctx_t *ctx);
243
244void
245isc_app_finish(void);
246/*!<
247 * \brief Finish an ISC library application.
248 *
249 * Notes:
250 *\li This call should be made at or near the end of main().
251 *
252 * Requires:
253 *\li isc_app_start() has been called.
254 *\li 'ctx' is a valid application context (for app_ctxfinish()).
255 *
256 * Ensures:
257 *\li Any resources allocated by isc_app_start() have been released.
258 */
259
260void
261isc_app_block(void);
262/*!<
263 * \brief Indicate that a blocking operation will be performed.
264 *
265 * Notes:
266 *\li If a blocking operation is in process, a call to isc_app_shutdown()
267 * or an external signal will abort the program, rather than allowing
268 * clean shutdown. This is primarily useful for reading user input.
269 *
270 * Requires:
271 * \li isc_app_start() has been called.
272 * \li No other blocking operations are in progress.
273 */
274
275void
276isc_app_unblock(void);
277/*!<
278 * \brief Indicate that a blocking operation is complete.
279 *
280 * Notes:
281 * \li When a blocking operation has completed, return the program to a
282 * state where a call to isc_app_shutdown() or an external signal will
283 * shutdown normally.
284 *
285 * Requires:
286 * \li isc_app_start() has been called.
287 * \li isc_app_block() has been called by the same thread.
288 */
289
290isc_result_t
291isc_appctx_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_appctx_t **ctxp);
292/*!<
293 * \brief Create an application context.
294 *
295 * Requires:
296 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context.
297 *\li 'ctxp' != NULL && *ctxp == NULL.
298 */
299
300void
301isc_appctx_destroy(isc_appctx_t **ctxp);
302/*!<
303 * \brief Destroy an application context.
304 *
305 * Requires:
306 *\li '*ctxp' is a valid application context.
307 *
308 * Ensures:
309 *\li *ctxp == NULL.
310 */
311
312void
313isc_appctx_settaskmgr(isc_appctx_t *ctx, isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr);
314/*!<
315 * \brief Associate a task manager with an application context.
316 *
317 * This must be done before running tasks within the application context.
318 *
319 * Requires:
320 *\li 'ctx' is a valid application context.
321 *\li 'taskmgr' is a valid task manager.
322 */
323
324void
325isc_appctx_setsocketmgr(isc_appctx_t *ctx, isc_socketmgr_t *socketmgr);
326/*!<
327 * \brief Associate a socket manager with an application context.
328 *
329 * This must be done before handling socket events within the application
330 * context.
331 *
332 * Requires:
333 *\li 'ctx' is a valid application context.
334 *\li 'socketmgr' is a valid socket manager.
335 */
336
337void
338isc_appctx_settimermgr(isc_appctx_t *ctx, isc_timermgr_t *timermgr);
339/*!<
340 * \brief Associate a socket timer with an application context.
341 *
342 * This must be done before handling timer events within the application
343 * context.
344 *
345 * Requires:
346 *\li 'ctx' is a valid application context.
347 *\li 'timermgr' is a valid timer manager.
348 */
349
350#ifdef USE_APPIMPREGISTER
351/*%<
352 * See isc_appctx_create() above.
353 */
354typedef isc_result_t
355(*isc_appctxcreatefunc_t)(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_appctx_t **ctxp);
356
357isc_result_t
358isc_app_register(isc_appctxcreatefunc_t createfunc);
359/*%<
360 * Register a new application implementation and add it to the list of
361 * supported implementations. This function must be called when a different
362 * event library is used than the one contained in the ISC library.
363 */
364
365isc_result_t
366isc__app_register(void);
367/*%<
368 * A short cut function that specifies the application module in the ISC
369 * library for isc_app_register(). An application that uses the ISC library
370 * usually do not have to care about this function: it would call
371 * isc_lib_register(), which internally calls this function.
372 */
373#endif /* USE_APPIMPREGISTER */
374
375ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
376
377#endif /* ISC_APP_H */
378
